thread.title: Thursday preview: US economic growth picks up second quarter, analysts estimate
thread.title_full: Thursday preview: US economic growth picks up second quarter, analysts estimate

title: Thursday preview: US economic growth picks up second quarter, analysts estimate
text:
2.37 0.00 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - As worries over China's slowdown persist, the US will be hoping for positive news closer to home with the release of gross domestic product data on Thursday. Analysts predict GDP rose an annualised 3.2% in the second quarter, accelerating from the previous quarter's 2.3% growth. 
A report on US personal consumption is forecast to reveal a 3.1% gain in the second quarter, compared to a 2.9% increase in the first three months. 
The US will also see the release of weekly jobless claims figures and pending home sales. Initial jobless claims may have fallen to 275,000 in the week to 22 August from 277,000 the previous week, according to analysts' estimates. Pending home sales are projected to grow 8.4% in July following an 11.1% climb in June. 
The Federal Reserve is looking for signs of further improvement in the economy before lifting interest rates for the first time in nine years. However concerns about the potential impact that China's flagging economy could have on the rest of the world has prompted analysts to push back expectations on the timing of a rate hike. 
On "Black Monday" when global stocks plunged on China woes, Barclays (LSE: BARC.L - news ) changed its call for the first rate increase from September 2015 to March 2016. 
"Given the uncertainty around the current global outlook, the timing of the rate hike seems more uncertain than usual. Should this episode of financial market volatility prove transitory, the FOMC could raise rates in December," economists at Barclays said.
